document.title: WIDA English Language Development Standards Framework, 2020 Edition Kindergarten—Grade 12

4D922FBB6271478BA4EBF7FFBA092A7E.description:
Show relationships between claims
with reasons and multiple sources of
evidence

542A3DB1AA434CFCB16967E8E0E751C6.description:
Select relevant information to support
claims with evidence from multiple
sources

1D7EA8DA800B430F9A2F3EDF04C66F88.description:
Evaluating point of view and credibility of
source, based on distinctions between fact
and opinion

8402A2FE83C54355A03D7A0464B173B7.description:
Analyzing relevant information from multiple
sources to develop claims in response to
compelling questions

4AED7664496B430AB42D27113EAA86C5.description:
Identifying topic and purpose (argue in favor
or against a position, present a balanced
interpretation, challenge perspective)

CD00EF6C87AF4466AC46C7B50786BE80.description:
Generalize probable causes and effects of
developments or events

AC678AE11FF44EF7A693AF6160360951.description:
Describe components, order, causes and
effects, or cycles using relevant examples
and details

D86C115468634219BA73C993E16651FD.description:
Evaluating disciplinary concepts and ideas
that are open to different interpretations

440754015BEA440186BC1846DF96EA1C.description:
Analyzing sources for a series of
contributing factors or causes

C4B43534599D44AFB7FF7FD50862DA29.description:
Determining different opinions in sources
for answering compelling and supporting
questions about phenomena or events

ACBEDB8AFC3E45BCB53825EFF8F109FC.description:
Signal logical relationships among reasoning,
relevant evidence, data, and/or a model when
making a claim

0059E024F16A49BCA918D35AC8FD2645.description: Establish a neutral tone or an objective stance

87B327C209E742A5B1F6D36CFAA060C2.description:
Make and define a claim based on evidence,
data, and/or model

B552605B0D32464695A17B1FAC2CBDE1.description:
Introduce topic/phenomenon in issues
related to the natural and designed world(s)

5956A3EF2A8746E8908AC4998EAC1173.description:
Distinguishing among facts, reasoned
judgment based on research findings,
and speculation in an explanation

DDBC9E0AA106456F9FE0A4CAABB08820.description:
Comparing reasoning and claims based
on evidence

34AEFECA6A0D4C77BC9BAB62F40EBF38.description:
Identifying relevant evidence from
data, models, and/or information from
investigations of phenomena or design
solutions

D824578D258847CCB981D863584BFCF4.description:
Summarize and/or compare multiple solutions
to a problem based on how well they meet
the criteria and constraints of the design
solution

EDE19368EE654AACBF2A9C1A2F569D5E.description:
Develop reasoning to show relationships
between evidence and claims

F83654A250CA44FC8931ECDA2414C20C.description:
Establish neutral or objective stance in
communicating results

2F97F47300874C2999E06256A4934424.description:
Describe observations and/or data about a
phenomenon

B79E685767B74CB7B9A29817671259AD.description:
Identifying evidence that supports
particular points in an explanation

AB96D501E2D44743948090CB91C2B866.description:
Obtaining and combining evidence and
information to help explain how or why a
phenomenon occurs

7E2ECC9A6C4840B3A6E83510C254B255.description:
Defining investigable questions or
design problems based on observations,
data, and prior knowledge about a
phenomenon

F5D225385C344816A4AE1E31DE53C346.description: Justify conclusions with patterns or rules

B224905D547B4CF6B57E1D12D5E4B3AE.description:
Generalize commonalities and differences
across cases

44BB4A4ADA454D0384B29634559760EF.description:
Create conjecture using definitions, patterns,
and rules

D40838E4D61943328B038FF55F20B52C.description:
Extracting patterns or rules from solution
strategies to create generalizations

FAA7375D23D14B08B1F787A1BD5D5232.description:
Distinguishing commonalities and
differences among ideas in justifications

BBAFE8C14A9E4C8E83B5EEB582A1ADC4.description:
Comparing conjectures with patterns,
and/or rules

82CCEFC87F754CB0AB63C18F61789170.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

23BAA1266E8F4E27BAE3A7AA243AB501.description: Describe data and/or steps to solve problem

1B56984666E84AF5AB5B0C6C312E7EE5.description:
Evaluating a pattern or structure that
follows a given rule

D7F34FB9508742F0B544281162B2A55D.description:
Logically connect opinions to appropriate
evidence, facts, and details; offer a concluding
statement or section

58523A98365847EABCBB3ECA2C455C07.description: Support opinions with reasons and information

FE5CC7BD0A8449A2AE7F2EFD4045A09D.description:
Introduce and develop a topic clearly; state an
opinion

792985242CE34E81B860BB78792C7DF3.description:
Evaluating how details, reasons, and
evidence support particular points in
a text

AC8D75668DE443C5BEBC45694ED8D11E.description:
Analyzing points of view about the
same event or topic

07E89BA9DE774A70A78BC742E5B6FB19.description:
Develop coherence and cohesion throughout
text

DBFE5EE8255A4C478C58A8593F9D024B.description:
Add precision and details to define, describe,
compare, and classify topic and/or entity

D05974552BB042DDA72800FF8B024EEE.description:
Introduce and define topic and/or entity for
audience

BE430DA181FB4209AD40229580FD45C1.description: Construct informational texts in language arts that

67F5533DE568452594CBD954D0D4C223.description:
Evaluating the impact of key word
choices in a text

6DD50F2E09064D659097987366D54C41.description:
Analyzing details and examples for key
attributes, qualities, and characteristics

F1FB65F6C77F41C08EAB5B9A84151BBC.description:
Identifying and summarizing main ideas
and key details

E198B1463AEF457EAAFDE2E72D5A8290.description:
Interpret informational texts in language arts
by

5EC9E55AA4E84F40AF51FAE866D5BD5B.description:
Develop story with complication and
resolution, time and event sequences

C78A52AFB21A4A83BAD85E83BFEB317A.description:
Develop and describe characters and
their relationships

744D22FF22F24EDE92D34177FE088633.description:
Determining the meaning of words and
phrases used in texts, including figurative
language, such as metaphors and similes

5AC6A917BE7641099C2575FF98C2F2C2.description:
Analyzing how character attributes and
actions develop across event sequences

21B5A0102D994F568CB4068976BA0A2C.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

C11E9D6549B949BF80C406A1FB99F0C4.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

A6638A7601BF41D4949B223E24DB1402.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

DFE95F43F2E74025981DE9182AB10304.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

757B7F4624BE40309D7A2842110C3DD4.description:
Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular
ways

B9DBE03938254E03BFBE1C385169D0F4.description:
Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular
outcomes

64234192BF3C44B88D25DCD76FA835AB.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

0DF02FD06D9D4A60BFE1E58127186D27.description:
Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and
effects

0B0C570033D343458AAE585EB82160FE.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

2F7604CB76D94DF98A23CDF8C3A3BA99.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

6690E39844EA41F9BDCACB27A5CB97C9.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

3103490CFAC64EBF83F8D00AC2EA00E4.description: Define and classify facts and interpretations; determine what is known vs. unknown

0BFD7CD958EA413BA5F6DDC0303C4AE4.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

ADE7F2D55691458EB95057AF716E74FE.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

373D3F756680481985FD77BEE642BEA4.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

7617F37EE1B648B1B4F4D678042A501A.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

789DC0D64A3F4F1EAFBE91EC75FF1878.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
